translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Yasas
The Elder Kimila’s Birth Story
“When Kakusandha, the One of Ten Powers,
the One of Famed Mind, had attained Final Emancipation,
I took a branch of the coral tree
and had a pavilion made.
Having gone to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,
I received the supreme boon,
I outshone the other gods,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deed.
Whether by day or by night,
whether walking or standing,
I was shaded by coral tree flowers,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deed.🔽In this very life,

analyzed: imasmiyā iva kappamhi  yam buddham abhipūjayi
translated: I worshipped the Buddha,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements were burnt up,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me,
I have done what the Buddha taught.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha taught.”🔽Thus the elder Kimila recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kimilo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Kimilattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kimilaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽kimila therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Elder Kimila’s Birth Story, the fourth.
